articles.title: DPRK Releases Joint Statement on Peace and Reunification
articles.content:
DPRK Releases Joint Statement on Peace and Reunification
 Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government, political parties and organizations at a joint meeting convened as regards the grave situation prevailing on the Korean Peninsula and between the north and the south discussed important issues of settling it and opening a new phase for peace and reunification and released a joint statement on Jan. 5.
					 In the joint statement, they set forth the following important proposal to the south Korean authorities, political parties and organizations, prompted by their patriotic decision to usher in a new era of independent reunification, peace and prosperity, reflecting the unanimous will of all Koreans for peace and reunification: 
					
					 1. We courteously propose having wide-ranging dialogue and negotiations with the political parties and organizations of south Korea including its authorities.
					
					 It is the review of the past three years that the issue of inter-Korean relations can never be solved by confrontation but it only sparks off an armed clash and war.
					
					 In order to mend the north-south relations now at the lowest ebb we will conduct positive dialogue and negotiations with the political parties and organizations of south Korea including its authorities, be they authorities or civilians, ruling parties or opposition parties, progressives or conservatives.
					
					 We call for an unconditional and early opening of talks between the authorities having real power and responsibility, in particular.
					
					 2. We are ready to meet anyone anytime and anywhere, letting bygones be bygones, if he or she is willing to go hands in hands with us.
					
					 For the great cause of the nation present is more important than yesterday and tomorrow is dearer than present. 
					
					 The danger of war will be defused and the day of peace, reunification and prosperity be brought earlier when all Koreans assert in concert and pool their wisdom and efforts.
					
					 3. We will discuss and solve all the issues related to the important matters of the nation including detente, peace, reconciliation, unity and cooperation at dialogue, negotiations and contacts.
					
					The north and the south are called upon to sincerely approach the discussion on the issues related to the important issues of the nation irrespective of partisan interests and strategy and isms and make positive efforts to seek agreed points to the maximum.
					
					 4. As an immediate offer, we propose discontinuing to heap slanders and calumnies on each other and refraining from any act of provoking each other in order to create an atmosphere of improving the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 Dialogue and negotiations cannot be properly conducted nor can they make smooth progress even if the north and south sit at the negotiating table when mud-slinging and provocative acts against each other are allowed.
					
					 We call on the north and the south to refrain from now from the smear campaign and provocative act of deepening misunderstanding and distrust and inciting confrontation and hostility.
					
					 Consistent is our stand to improve the inter-Korean relations, promote national reconciliation and unity and open a landmark phase of peace and reunification on the Korean Peninsula through dialogue and negotiations.
					
					 The government, political parties and organizations of the DPRK express expectation that the authorities, political parties and organizations of south Korea will positively respond to their sincere proposal and appeal for weathering the crisis on the peninsula and between the north and the south. They also call on all the Koreans at home and abroad, all governments, political parties and organizations in the world, international organizations and progressive people that love justice, truth and peace to extend warm support and solidarity to them.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets Czech Ambassador
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets Czech Ambassador
						
 Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun met and had a talk with Martin Tomco, Czech ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a farewell visit to him on Wednesday.

articles.title: Provincial Mass Rallies Held
articles.content:
Provincial Mass Rallies Held
Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- Mass Rallies were held in South Phyongan Province, North Phyongan Province, South Hwanghae Province, Jagang Province and South Hamgyong Province on Wednesday to vow to thoroughly implement the militant tasks put forward in the joint New Year editorial and respond to the letter sent by the employees of the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex to all other working people across the country.
					 Present there were officials of local party, power and economic organs and working people's organizations, working people and youth and students.
					
					 After reports were delivered at the rallies, their participants heard the letter and speeches.
					
					 The reporters and speakers said that the joint New Year editorial of Rodong Sinmun, Joson Inmingun and Chongnyon Jonwi serves as a militant banner calling upon all the party members, soldiers and people to effect a new great surge.
					
					 They stressed the need for the party members and other working people in the provinces to be staunch revolutionaries of the Songun era who display the spirit of safeguarding the leader at any cost and who are possessed of the spirit of national self-esteem, the spirit of self-reliance, love for future and the spirit of devotion. 
					
					 They called for further developing the local industry and operating the light industrial factories at full capacity this year to mass-produce varieties of consumer goods.
					
					 They underlined the need to bring about a great leap forward in the grain production by thoroughly implementing the Party's policy on the agricultural revolution and, at the same time, hasten the construction of dwelling houses and roads and spruce up the streets, villages and worksites better in a hygienic and cultured manner.

articles.title: Floral Basket from Chinese Company
articles.content:
Floral Basket from Chinese Company
 Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a big floral basket from an aquatic products and foodstuff co. ltd. in Dandong, China on the New Year. 
					 It was handed to the Dandong Branch of the DPRK Consulate General in Shenyang on last Saturday.

articles.title: Asynchronous Locomotive Developed
articles.content:
Asynchronous Locomotive Developed
 Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- The Kim Jong Thae Electric Locomotive Complex in the DPRK has developed an asynchronous locomotive of the latest style.
					 The locomotive, called Songun Red Flag No. 1, is lower in electricity consumption, larger in output and better in operation system and traction than other kinds of locomotives. 
					
					 The developers of the new locomotive have invented a high-capacity asynchronous motor, self-steering bogie, high-speed compressor, various kinds of converters and electric apparatuses and established a computer control system.
					
					 They have also made an asynchronous electric tractor, auxiliary gearing and running gear.
					
					 The new locomotive has proved successful in test run.
					
					 Its development is a step forward in putting the country's railway transport on a scientific and technological basis.

articles.title: Hot Springs of Lake Chon on Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
Hot Springs of Lake Chon on Mt. Paektu
						
 Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- Lake Chon on Mt. Paektu in the northern part of Korea boasts of hot springs good for medical treatment.
					 Paektu Hot Spring of a belt shape is about 300 meters long and ten meters wide along the shore of the lake at the foot of Janggun Peak. 
					
					 Its maximum temperature is 73 degrees C and average 53 degrees C.
					
					 Its pH is 7.0 and total amount of mineral matters is 2 351.06 milligrams per liter. It is efficacious for chronic bronchitis, arteriosclerosis, nervous disease and other diseases.
					
					 At the foot of Paekam Peak in the northern part of the lake, Paekam Hot Spring gushes out in all seasons, the maximum temperature 46 degrees C and average 40 degrees C. 
					
					 Its pH is 7.0 and total amount of mineral matters is 841.47 milligrams per liter. It is good for arthritis, dermatitis and other diseases. 
					
					 Rakwon Hot Spring has medical value as great as Kangso mineral water. 
					
					 They are all sodium bicarbonate springs.

articles.title: Traditional Health Drinks
articles.content:
Traditional Health Drinks
						
 Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- There are many traditional health drinks in Korea.
					 Sweet drinks like kamju and sikhye began to be made on the basis of diastatic enzyme as early as in the period of Ancient Korea (B.C early 30th century-B.C. 108).
					
					 Included in the national drinks are alcoholic ones like makgolli and kamju and nonalcoholic ones like sikhye, sujonggwa, khongguk and kkaeguk.
					
					 Makgolli brewed with grain has been one of the Koreans' favorite drinks from old times.
					
					 The nutritious drink with sweet and sour taste is simple and quick in preparation. It is still popular among the Korean people.
					
					 Sikhye is prepared with boiled rice or boiled glutinous rice fermented by malt, mixed with honey or sugar. It is not only nutritious but also digestible.
					
					 Sujonggwa is ginger-infused sugar water with pine nuts and cinnamon powder floating and dried persimmon and pear soaked in it.
					
					 Kkaeguk (sesame tea) is well received in hot season.
					
					 Sungnyung (scorched-rice tea) is also a typical national drink.
					
					 It, easy to make after boiling rice, is taken after meal.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Blasts Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Blasts Anti-DPRK "Human Rights" Racket
Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- Recently the south Korean authorities let the "Human Rights Committee" make public the so-called "three-phase policy roadmap." In this roadmap they urged the DPRK to "accept the international human rights norms" and "set up a mechanism for protecting human rights" on groundless charges. They went the lengths of crying out for setting up a "north human rights organization" and strengthening "independence of the Ministry of Justice."
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a by-lined commentary carried in this regard brands the publication of the above-said roadmap as a serious political provocation to the DPRK.
					
					 It is preposterous, indeed, for the south Korean authorities to talk about "human rights" and the like as they are the arch criminals who turned the society of south Korea into the worst tundra of democracy and human rights in the world.
					
					 It is the ulterior aim of the conservative forces to hype the non-existent "human rights issue" of somebody and build up a public opinion critical of it in a bid to bring down the inviolable system in the DPRK, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities have become noisier in their anti-DPRK "human rights" rackets since the warship "Cheonan" case and the Yonphyong Island shelling incident. Steeped in the extreme consciousness of confrontation, they are busy intensifying the "human rights" smear campaign, while increasing their military threat to the DPRK. Through these moves they seek to realize the ridiculous wild ambition for "achieving unification under liberal democracy."
					
					 There is no such human rights issue in the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean conservative forces are sadly mistaken if they calculate they can get something from such smear campaign based on misinformation. Their anti-DPRK "human rights" racket would only result in aggravating the mistrust and confrontation between the north and the south.

articles.title: Japan's Blind Subservience to US Assailed
articles.content:
Japan's Blind Subservience to US Assailed
 Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- The chief Cabinet secretary of Japan recently let loose a spate of piffles that "the existence of the U.S. marine base in Okinawa has great significance" and "he could not but request the prefecture to cover the expenses for the base." 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a by-lined commentary in this regards observes: This made it clear that the Japanese authorities are poised to keep the U.S. forces base in Okinawa and continue covering its upkeep. 
					
					 Nowhere else in the world one can find such country as Japan which is hosting huge aggressor forces of other country under the pretext of "security" and paying a stupendous amount of money as their upkeep. 
					
					 It is quite evident that Japanese politics has neither principle nor proper standpoint nor ism, the commentary notes, and goes on: 
					
					 As a matter of fact, U.S. troops are present in Okinawa not for ensuring the "security" of Japan. They are forces for aggression and war as they are tasked to carry out the U.S. military hard-line policy and hegemonic strategy towards Northeast Asia. The Japanese authorities must know well about this but are working hard to keep the base in the prefecture defying the people's opposition. 
					
					 Japan will never have its future as long as it blindly follows the U.S. without its own proper viewpoint.

articles.title: Defusing Inter-Korean Confrontation Called for
articles.content:
Defusing Inter-Korean Confrontation Called for
 Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- In order to open a new phase of the independent reunification of the country this year, the Korean nation should defuse the confrontation between the north and the south at an early date, first of all, says Rodong Sinmun in a bylined article Wednesday.
					 To defuse the political and military confrontation is the primary requirement for improving the inter-Korean relations, promoting the national reconciliation and cooperation and reunifying the country, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The inter-Korean relations cannot be improved while the tension is being escalated and the danger of a war is increasing.
					
					 The inter-Korean relations can neither be improved nor can the efforts to achieve reconciliation and cooperation prove successful nor can peace be preserved as long as the said relations remain in the state of confrontation and on the brink of war without dialogue, contact and cooperation.
					
					 The developments on the Korean Peninsula prove that it is impossible to wipe out the distrust and misunderstanding between fellow countrymen, nor is it possible for the north and the south to trust and get reconciled with each other and they will only suffer from military clashes and serious disasters unless the south Korean conservative authorities put an end to their policy for confrontation and war against the nation, peace and reunification.
					
					 As the joint New Year editorial stressed, the stand of attaching importance to the nation, the stand toward independent reunification, is the touchstone by which to distinguish patriotism from treachery.
					
					 The separatist forces at home and abroad are becoming evermore pronounced in their anti-reunification moves, but the trend of the times is definitely in favor of improved inter-Korean relations and national reunification. No force on earth can break the will of the Koreans to advance toward the independent reunification, peace and prosperity in the idea of "By our nation itself" reflected in the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.

articles.title: Demolition of Concrete Wall Demanded
articles.content:
Demolition of Concrete Wall Demanded
 Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- The Thailand-DPRK Friendship Association issued a statement on Dec. 28 last year, 31 years since the south Korean puppet authorities built the concrete wall dividing Korea into two.
					 The statement said that dialogue was suspended between the north and the south, cooperation and exchange between their non-governmental organizations were halted and peace and security of the Korean Peninsula gravely threatened. These are attributable to the confrontation policy pursued by the south Korean authorities toward the DPRK, it added.
					
					 The reality goes to prove that the concrete wall is the hurdle for whose early demolition all Koreans and all other peace-loving people of the world should struggle as they aspire after the reconciliation, unity and reunification of the nation, it noted, demanding:
					
					 The concrete wall should be pulled down without delay for the reconciliation, unity and reunification of the Korean nation.

articles.title: DPRK's Anniversaries Observed Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Anniversaries Observed Abroad
						
Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- Meetings were held in Romania, Norway, South Africa and Bulgaria on December 21 and 23 last year to mark the 19th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il as supreme commander of the Korean People's Army and the 93rd birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 Constantin Rotaru, chairman of the Romanian Socialist Union, said at a meeting that the Korean People's Army has grown to be a matchless army capable of foiling any move of the imperialist allied forces including the U.S. at one blow as it holds Kim Jong Il in high esteem as its supreme commander.
					
					 Dag Norum, chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway, said that the DPRK has steadily advanced along the road of socialism thanks to the KPA which has developed into a-match-for-a hundred revolutionary armed forces under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Bonakele Majuba, secretary of the Mfumalanga Provincial Committee of the South African Communist Party, said that Kim Jong Il ceaselessly provided field guidance to various sectors of the national economy, widely leading the Korean people in their drive for building a great prosperous and powerful nation, adding that he is a peerlessly great man and distinguished leader.
					
					 Vasilka Nikiforova, chief of the "Kim Il Sung Library" in Sofia, Bulgaria, referred to the fact that Kim Jong Suk embarked on the road of revolution at her early years and took part in the great anti-Japanese war, adding that she gave birth to Kim Jong Il, the future of Korea.
					
					 Messages of greetings to Kim Jong Il were adopted at the meetings in Norway, South Africa and Bulgaria.

articles.title: DPRK's Anniversaries Observed in Britain
articles.content:
DPRK's Anniversaries Observed in Britain 
Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- The British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association made public a statement on Dec. 25 last year. It marked the 19th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il as supreme commander of the Korean People's Army and the 93rd birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 Kim Jong Il's gaining of the supreme commandership of the KPA was a manifestation of the Korean people's profound trust in him, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Peace has been preserved on the Korean Peninsula thanks to his Songun politics and rare commanding art.
					
					 He displayed his distinguished qualities as an invincible and iron-willed commander in the days of commanding the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK.
					
					 Thanks to his Songun politics the KPA has developed into a mainstay and driving force of the revolution and the DPRK into a socialist military power having nuclear deterrent, a country which launched satellites.

articles.title: Story of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Story of Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- One March day of Juche 87 (1998), General Secretary Kim Jong Il visited a naval port.
					 He went round several places of the port to learn about seamen's living conditions.
					
					 Entering a cosy bedroom, he told officials accompanying him to rearrange the beds.
					
					 He said if the bedsides were placed by the window, seamen could not avoid cold wind from window. He also said the bed should be rearranged so that they could see the sky above the homeland, not a wall of the bedroom, after opening their eyes in the morning.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe gran cesto de flores de compania china
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe gran cesto de flores de compania china
						
Pyongyang, 5 de enero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente  Kim Jong Il recibio un gran cesto de flores que le dedicara una compania limitada de productos acuaticos y comestibles de Dandong de China en ocasion del Ano Nuevo.
					  El cesto fue trasladado el dia primero a la sucursal de Dandong del Consulado General de Corea en Shenyang.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de consuelo al presidente egipcio
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de consuelo al presidente egipcio 
Pyongyang, 5 de enero (ATCC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 4 un mensaje de condolencias al presidente de la Republica Arabe de Egipto, Muhammad Hosni Mubarak, en relacion con que muchos civiles inocentes perdieron la vida en el atentado terrorista dinamitero estallado en la ciudad de Alexandria.
					El remitente expresa profunda compasion y condolencias al destinatario y por su conducto, a las victimas y familiares de los difuntos y manifiesta la solidaridad con los esfuerzos del gobierno y el pueblo egipcios para fomentar la estabilidad social y la unidad bajo la direccion del mandatario.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun critica campana de DDHH contra la RPDC
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun critica campana de DDHH contra la RPDC
						
Pyongyang, 5 de enero (ATCC) -- Recientemente, las autoridades surcoreanas publicaron la llamada "hoja de ruta politica de tres etapas" por conducto del "Comite de Derechos Humanos".
					En este documento ellas demandaron absurdamente a la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea  "aceptar las normas internacionales de derechos humanos" y "establecer el sistema de proteccion de DDHH". Para colmo, anunciaron que promoverian la "fundacion de un aparato de DDHH y la independencia del poder judicial" en el Norte de Corea.
					
					  En su comentario individual difundido este miercoles, el diario Rodong Sinmun califica la publicacion de esa "hoja de ruta" de grave provocacion politica contra la RPDC.
					
					  Es muy absurdo que los que hablan tanto de "DDHH" son los que convirtieron la sociedad surcoreana en uno de los peores lugares del mundo para la democracia y los DDHH, revela el comentarista y prosigue:
					
					  La siniestra intencion de la banda de conservadores surcoreanos es derrumbar el sagrado regimen y sistema de la RPDC ventilando en la opinion publica el inexistente problema de "DDHH".
					
					  La campana anti-RPDC en el tema de "DDHH" se torna cada vez mas brutal luego del incidente de hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan" y el de canonazos en la isla Yonphyong.
					
					  Los titeres surcoreanos, contagiados con la extremada conciencia conflictiva, endurecen al mismo tiempo la amenaza militar sobre la RPDC con la meta de realizar su absurda ambicion de "reunificar bajo el sistema democratico liberal".
					
					  Realmente, en la RPDC no existe ningun problema de DDHH.
					
					  Estarian muy equivocados los conservadores surcoreanos si piensan conseguir algo lanzando la campana de DDHH anti-RPDC con datos inventados.
					
					  Esta campana no dara otro resultado que profundizar aun mas la desconfianza y la confrontacion entre ambas partes de Corea.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun critica la actitud servil a EE.UU. de Japon
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun critica la actitud servil a EE.UU. de Japon
Pyongyang, 5 de enero (ATCC) -- Recientemente, el director del secretariado del gabinete de Japon dijo que "es muy importante la existencia de la base de infantes de marina de Estados Unidos en Okinawa" y "no hay otro remedio que pedir al departamento de Okinawa que cubra los gastos por el mantenimiento de ella". 
					Este hecho evidencia que las autoridades japonesas piensan seguir manteniendo a sus expensas la base militar norteamericana en Okinawa. 
					
					Senala asi el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual divulgado este miercoles y prosigue:
					
					En este mundo es muy dificil encontrar a un pais como Japon que bajo el pretexto de la "seguridad", mantiene en su territorio a muchas tropas agresoras extranjeras y paga enormes sumas para mantener las bases de ellas. 
					
					Esto significa que la politica de Japon carece de principios y doctrina propia.
					
					Realmente, las tropas norteamericanas presentes en Okinawa no sirven para la "seguridad" de Japon, sino funcionan como aparato de agresion y guerra para cumplir la estrategia de despotismo y hegemonia militares de EE.UU. sobre la region del Nordeste Asiatico.
					
					Sin embargo, las autoridades japonesas pretenden mantener la base militar norteamericana en Okinawa, pese a la fuerte oposicion de los habitantes. 
					
					Mientras obedezca a ciegas a EE.UU., Japon no tendra su futuro.
